definition: medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison

sentences.english: Follow the directions on the medicine bottle.
sentences.chinese: 請按藥瓶上的服法說明服藥。

sentences.english: Both his hands shake as if he were trying to open a pair of jars.
sentences.chinese: 當他盡力去打開兩個藥瓶時，他的兩隻手顫抖着。

sentences.english: Before you take the medicine, you should read the instructions on the bottle carefully.
sentences.chinese: 在服藥之前，你應當仔細看藥瓶上的用法說明。

sentences.english: By the time his mother found the vial, he had been steroid-free for months.
sentences.chinese: 到媽媽發現藥瓶爲止他已有數月不再注射。

sentences.english: Dull the monotony of taking daily pills by jazzing up your pill box.
sentences.chinese: 每天打開藥瓶吃藥讓人感到很乏味。

sentences.english: The prescription medications were made out in the actor's name and were in the prescription bottles or packets.
sentences.chinese: 處方藥是以萊斯的名義開的，都在醫用藥瓶或藥包裏。

sentences.english: The manufacturing issueshave included the presence of metal shavings in some children's medicinebottles.
sentences.chinese: 製造問題包括一些兒童專用藥瓶中存在金屬碎屑。

sentences.english: One dose from a multiuse vial contains about 25 micrograms of mercury.
sentences.chinese: 多劑藥瓶中每一劑疫苗含有約25微克汞。

sentences.english: The bottle even had “placebo” printed on it.
sentences.chinese: 甚至把“安慰劑”印在藥瓶上。

sentences.english: Just following the directions on the bottle.
sentences.chinese: 請照藥瓶上的說明服用。

definition: variant of 門閂|门闩[men2 shuan1]
horizontal bar to hold a door closed (made of wood or metal)/door bolt
to return something to its rightful owner
